titleStmt.title: Annual Report, The Col. W. F. Cody ("Buffalo Bill") Historical Pictures Company, 1914

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Annual Report, The Col. W. F. Cody ("Buffalo Bill") Historical Pictures Company, 1914

div1.note: JAMES R. NOLAND, Secretary of State

N. B. — This blank must be signed in two places by the President and Secretary of the Company, and the Corporate seal attached thereto and acknowledged before a Notary Public. (See extracts of Act on back hereof.)
div1.head: ANNUAL REPORT
MISCELLANEOUS
div1.ab: ( Foreign Domestic) Indicate of Foreign or Domestic by drawing line through word in bracket.

The COL W F CODY ("BUFFALO BILL") HISTORICAL PICTURES COMPANY
(Name of Corporation)
FIRST. Names of Officers and their several places of business.

list.item: Business Address 1544 Champa St., Denver, Colo
Business Address 1544 Champa St., Denver, Colo.
Business Address 521 First National Bank Building, Chicago, Ill.

div1.ab: SECOND. Names of Directors or Trustees, with the residence and business address of each:

list.item: F. G. Bonfils, 1003 Corona St., 1544 Champa St., Denver
William F. Cody 237 Symes Buiding, Denver
Geo. K. Spoor 521 First National Bank Bldg., Chicago, Ill
H. H. Tammen, 1061 Humboldt St., 1544 Champa St., Denver.
V. R. Day, 521 First Natl Bank Bldg., Chicago, Ill.

div1.ab: THIRD. Total amount of capital stock as fixed and determined by articles of incorporation and amendments thereto $ $12,000.00

list.item: Amount of increased capital stock, if any. $ none
Date of amendment to increase capital stock
Amount of decrease of capital stock, if any $
Date of amendment to decrease capital stock
That portion of said capital stock represented by its corporate capital, property and assets located and employed in the State of Colorado $

div1.ab: FOURTH. The proportion of said stock actually paid in $ Full amount
FIFTH. Setting forth how the same was paid:
SIXTH. Amount of indebtedness at date of filing this report $ 20, 523. 10
SEVENTH. State whether or not engaged in actual operation within the State of Colorado: no

EIGHTH. Such other information as will show with reasonable fullness and certainty the condition of real and personal property, and the financial condition of your company at the date of filing this report
div1.p: The operations to date have consisted only of producing and manufacturing motion pictures, which as yet have not been put on the market; and the above indebtedness represents money advanced to cover expenses.
In Witness Whereof, The President of siad corporation has hereunto set his hand and caused the corporate seal to be affixed this 18th day of February, A. D. 1914

figure.p: The Col. W. F. Cody ("Buffalo Bill") Historical Pictures Co. SEAL

div1.closer:
Attest: H. H. Tammen
Secretary.
F. G. Bonfils
President.

div1.p: Before me, Elmer W. Jones, a Notary Public in and for said County and State, personally appeared F. G. Bonfils, President, and H. H. Tammen, Secretary of The Col. W. F. Cody ("Buffalo Bill") Historical Pictures Company personally known to me to be the persons whose names are subscribed to the foregoing annual report of said corporation, who each being first duly sworn, upon his oath deposes and says, each for himself and not one for the other, that he is the President and Secretary, respectively, of the said The Col W F Cody ("Buffalo Bill") Historical Pictures Company and that the facts thus set forth in said annual reports are true, full and complete, and that they are such President and Secretary, respectively, of the said corporation, made, signed and delivered the said annual report in compliance with the statute in such case made and provided.

figure.p: The Col. W. F. Cody ("Buffalo Bill") Historical Pictures Co. SEAL

div1.closer:
F G Bonfils
President.
H H Tammen
Secretary.

postscript.p: Subscribed and sworn to before me this 20th day of February, A. D. 1914
My commission expires February 26th, A. D. 1914

figure.p: Elmer W. Jones City & County of Denver, Colo. NOTARY PUBLIC

div1.ab:
ENDORSED

Historical Pictures Co

JAMES B. PEARCE, Sec'y of State
By Carl Albin Cashier.
